To one who was sitting alone,

â€œIn a different way, when the Lord of the World
was standing, the supreme man;
The practice of the monks was one way,
but now it is seen in a different way.
A protection from cold and wind,
a covering for shame and the private parts;
They ate in moderation,
being content with whatever was available.
Whether it was fine or coarse,
whether it was little or much;
They ate for the purpose of sustenance,
not greedy, not infatuated.
With regard to requisites for life,
medicine, and other requirements;
They were not very eager,
as they were for the destruction of the pollutants.
In the wilderness, at the foot of trees,
in caves, in grottoes;
